claim: EO 14067 sets out a whole-of-government framework for United States policy on digital assets, identifying objectives spanning consumer and investor protection, financial stability, illicit finance, international cooperation, and exploration of a U.S. CBDC.
necessary: Sec. 4 — Policy and Actions Related to United States Central Bank Digital Currencies
Sec. 6 — Actions to Promote Financial Stability, Mitigate Systemic Risk, and Strengthen Market Integrity
Sec. 7 — Actions to Limit Illicit Finance and Associated National Security Risks
Sec. 8 — Policy and Actions Related to Fostering International Cooperation and United States Competitiveness
sufficient: Sec. 4 — Policy and Actions Related to United States Central Bank Digital Currencies
counterfactuals: If Sec. 4 omitted CBDC exploration, the description would not include a U.S. CBDC.
If Sec. 3 did not assign interagency coordination (APNSA/APEP), it would not qualify as a whole-of-government framework.
If Sec. 6 and Sec. 7 were removed, the description would not cover financial stability or illicit finance.
If Sec. 8 were absent, international cooperation would not be part of the described scope.
